com.googlecode.transloader
Class ObjectWrapper

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.transloader.ObjectWrapper

public final class ObjectWrapper
extends Object

The wrapper appropriate for wrapping around all Objects referencing Classes from potentially foreign ClassLoaders.

Author:
Jeremy Wales

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a new ObjectWrapper around the given object, which will use the given CloningStrategy when required.

Constructor Detail

ObjectWrapper

public ObjectWrapper(Object objectToWrap,
                     CloningStrategy cloningStrategy)
Constructs a new ObjectWrapper around the given object, which will use the given CloningStrategy when required. Note that using implementation of Transloader is the recommended way to produce these.

Parameters:
objectToWrap - the object to wrap
cloningStrategy - the strategy for cloning
Method Detail

isNull

public boolean isNull()
Indicates whether or not null is what is wrapped.

Returns:
true if the wrapped "object" is actually null

getUnwrappedSelf

public Object getUnwrappedSelf()
Provides direct access to the wrapped object.

Returns:
the actual wrapped object without any wrapping

isInstanceOf

public boolean isInstanceOf(String typeName)
Indicates whether or not the wrapped object is an instance of the type with the given name in the wrapped object's ClassLoader(s). It takes a parameter of type String instead of Class so that the test can be performed for Classes that do not have an equivalent in the caller's ClassLoader.

Parameters:
typeName - the name of the type against which the wrapped object will be checked
Returns:
true if the wrapped object is an instance of the type with the given name in the wrapped object's ClassLoader(s)

cloneWith

public Object cloneWith(ClassLoader classLoader)
Gets an equivalent of the wrapped object with all Classes referenced being loaded from the given ClassLoader. Every object referenced in the object graph starting with the object returned will be able to be cast to its respective types in the given ClassLoader.

This implementation employs the CloningStrategy configured at construction. Note that using CloningStrategy.MINIMAL (which is not the default strategy in Transloader.DEFAULT) will often effect some changes within the object graph that starts with the wrapped object itself, as opposed to producing a completely new, seperate graph. Using CloningStrategy.MAXIMAL instead prevents this, producing a purely seperate clone without any changes within the wrapped object graph, at the cost of potentially far greater cloning effort. An object graph altered by cloning with CloningStrategy.MINIMAL can of course be restored entirely for use with other objects of Classes from its original ClassLoader(s) by cloning it back with those original ClassLoader(s), but this is an extra coding step and somewhat reduces the effort saved by not using CloningStrategy.MAXIMAL in the first place.

Parameters:
classLoader - the ClassLoader to use in creating an equivalent of the wrapped object
Returns:
an equivalent of the wrapped object with all Classes referenced being loaded from the given ClassLoader

invoke

public Object invoke(InvocationDescription description)
Invokes on the wrapped object the method described by the given invocation description, with the parameters given by the same. Finds the method reflectively using parameter types loaded from the wrapped object's ClassLoader(s). Any parameters which refer to Classes that are foreign to the wrapped object's ClassLoader(s) are cloned using the CloningStrategy injected at construction.

Parameters:
description - the description of the invocation to be performed
Returns:
the result of performing the invocation described by description

makeCastableTo

public Object makeCastableTo(Class targetInterface)
Makes an implementation of the given interface that calls through to the wrapped object. This is particularly useful if you have access in the current ClassLoader to an interface that the wrapped object is expected to implement, except that it actually implements the equivalent from a different ClassLoader. It is therefore usefully employed in conjunction with isInstanceOf(String).

This method will not fail fast if the wrapped object does not implement its own ClassLoader's equivalent to the given interface, so can also be used for "duck"-typing, as a more syntactically elegant alternative to using invoke(InvocationDescription), if desired.

Parameters:
targetInterface - the interface that the returned object can be cast to
Returns:
a Proxy to the wrapped object that implements desiredInterface
